content.description: Getting off of the ground is a little cruxy as are the moves between the last bolt and the chains.  Hornets have nested inside of the rock wall, coming in and out of the bolt holes, and are especially prevalent on this climb.  If hornets are present, give yourself the courtesy of calling this a 5.6.
content.protection:
Five bolts.

Top rope on the fixed, bent-gate, biners at the end of chains.
content.location: On the north side of the wall, the east most of the three climbs.

content.description: Crux is near the bottom as is the case with many of the routes on the wall.  This climb is a good candidate for free soloing as after the first couple of moves, every single move allows for all four limbs to be on bomber holds.
content.protection: Top rope on the fixed, bent-gate, biners at the end of chains.
content.location: On the north side of the wall, the west most of the three climbs.
